info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 2:02PM EDT until May 28 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston WV
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central West Virginia, including the following county, Taylor.
* WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 158 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen since Tuesday, most of it overnight and this morning. Flooding is already occurring. Pubic and Emergency Management reported Route 50 in Prunytown completely flooded with nearby stream out of its banks. Also flooding throughout mostly northern Taylor County along back roads and poor drainage areas. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grafton, Flemington, Tygart Lake State Park, Knottsville, McGee, Thornton, Meadland and Rosemont. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
